summary: Complete workflow for converting Figma designs to coded prototypes using GoA Design System components

requiredFrameworkSelection.prompt: REQUIRED: Choose Your Framework - Before we start, tell me: 'I want this built in [React/Angular]'
requiredFrameworkSelection.reasoning: Framework choice determines import statements, component syntax, and event handling patterns

enhancedAnalysisWithJSON.description: Integration with Figma Component Export JSON for precision mapping
benefits: Instantly identify which GoA components are used
Extract exact configurations (size, type, state, etc.)
Preserve text content from the design
Map component relationships and layout structure
Generate more accurate code with precise component props

pageStructure.rule: ALWAYS use GoabOneColumnLayout as root component for government pages
pageStructure.reasoning: Required for government compliance, accessibility, and design system consistency

codeExample.react:
<GoabOneColumnLayout>
  <section slot="header">
    <GoabMicrositeHeader type="live" />
    <GoabAppHeader heading="Service Name" />
  </section>
  <GoabPageBlock width="704px">
    {/* All content goes here */}
  </GoabPageBlock>
  <section slot="footer">
    <GoabAppFooter />
  </section>
</GoabOneColumnLayout>
codeExample.angular:
<goab-one-column-layout>
  <section slot="header">
    <goab-microsite-header type="live"></goab-microsite-header>
    <goab-app-header heading="Service Name"></goab-app-header>
  </section>
  <goab-page-block width="704px">
    <!-- All content goes here -->
  </goab-page-block>
  <section slot="footer">
    <goab-app-footer></goab-app-footer>
  </section>
</goab-one-column-layout>

componentFirst.rule: ALWAYS assume a GoA component exists first
process: If JSON provided: Parse component list and configurations first
If image only: Identify visual element and search project knowledge
Search thoroughly with multiple search terms
If no exact match found: Search for related/similar components
If still no component found: Explicitly tell user: 'I cannot find a GoA component for [describe element]. How should I implement this?'
componentFirst.never: Default to custom implementation without explicit user guidance

realComponents.rule: NEVER create mock components or placeholders
realComponents.reasoning: All styling and behavior comes from the official design system

withJSONExport: 1. Parse JSON export first to identify exact GoA components used
2. Map component names to their React/Angular equivalents
4. Preserve text content from the JSON
5. Apply proper GoA layout patterns (always use OneColumnLayout)
imageOnly: 1. First assumption: 'There must be a GoA component for this pattern'
2. Search thoroughly in project knowledge for the component
3. If no exact match: Search for related components
4. Only if no component found: Flag with user and ask how to proceed
5. Never default to custom implementation without explicit user guidance

governmentNoticeBanner.usage: For 'This is an official website of the Alberta Government' messaging

footerAreas.usage: Government footer with navigation and utility links

textInputs.pattern: Always wrap inputs in FormItem for proper labels

dropdowns.usage: For selection lists and option menus

checkboxRadio.usage: For boolean selections and option groups

react.naming: PascalCase with Goab prefix (GoabButton, GoabInput, GoabFormItem)
react.stateManagement: useState for form state and interactions
setupRequirements: Add ionicons scripts to HTML head

angular.forms: FormBuilder and reactive forms integration with formControlName
setupRequirements: Add ionicons scripts to index.html head

always: Complete component code using real GoA components (never placeholders)
Component explanation - why each GoA component was chosen for the design
Setup instructions - exact dependencies and configuration needed
Accessibility notes - built-in GoA accessibility features
Responsive behavior - how components adapt to different screen sizes
codeQuality: Working event handlers and state management
Form validation with proper error handling
Proper component hierarchy and layout structure
Framework-specific best practices (React hooks, Angular reactive forms)

enhancedAnalysis: 1. User specifies framework: 'I want this built in [React/Angular]'
3. User uploads Figma component export JSON (optional but recommended)
4. Parse JSON first to identify exact GoA components and configurations
5. Map visual elements to GoA component equivalents
6. Generate complete, functional code using real GoA components
7. Provide setup instructions and component explanations
standardAnalysis: 1. User specifies framework: 'I want this built in [React/Angular]'
3. Identify visual patterns and search for corresponding GoA components
4. Map layout structure to GoA layout patterns (OneColumnLayout)
5. Generate complete, functional code using real GoA components
6. Provide setup instructions and component explanations

aiHints.autoTrigger: When user mentions building/converting designs or shares design images
aiHints.frameworkRequired: Always require framework selection before starting any conversion
aiHints.thoroughComponentSearch: Always search project knowledge extensively before declaring component doesn't exist
aiHints.mandatoryPatterns: Always use OneColumnLayout for page structure, always use real GoA components
aiHints.qualityStandards: Generate working, interactive prototypes suitable for user testing and stakeholder demos
